connector.description: Reading and write from/to an HBase store (Hadoop database).

camel.source.endpoint.cellMappingStrateg.name: camel.source.endpoint.cellMappingStrategyFactory
camel.source.endpoint.cellMappingStrateg.description: To use a custom CellMappingStrategyFactory that is responsible for mapping cells.

camel.source.endpoint.filters.name: camel.source.endpoint.filters
camel.source.endpoint.filters.description: A list of filters to use.

camel.source.endpoint.mappingStrategyCla.name: camel.source.endpoint.mappingStrategyClassName
camel.source.endpoint.mappingStrategyCla.description: The class name of a custom mapping strategy implementation.

camel.source.endpoint.mappingStrategyNam.name: camel.source.endpoint.mappingStrategyName
camel.source.endpoint.mappingStrategyNam.description: The strategy to use for mapping Camel messages to HBase columns. Supported values: header, or body. One of: [header] [body]

camel.source.endpoint.rowMapping.name: camel.source.endpoint.rowMapping
camel.source.endpoint.rowMapping.description: To map the key/values from the Map to a HBaseRow. The following keys is supported: rowId - The id of the row. This has limited use as the row usually changes per Exchange. rowType - The type to covert row id to. Supported operations: CamelHBaseScan. family - The column family. Supports a number suffix for referring to more than one columns. qualifier - The column qualifier. Supports a number suffix for referring to more than one columns. value - The value. Supports a number suffix for referring to more than one columns valueType - The value type. Supports a number suffix for referring to more than one columns. Supported operations: CamelHBaseGet, and CamelHBaseScan.

camel.source.endpoint.rowModel.name: camel.source.endpoint.rowModel
camel.source.endpoint.rowModel.description: An instance of org.apache.camel.component.hbase.model.HBaseRow which describes how each row should be modeled

camel.source.endpoint.userGroupInformati.name: camel.source.endpoint.userGroupInformation
camel.source.endpoint.userGroupInformati.description: Defines privileges to communicate with HBase such as using kerberos.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Is default unlimited, but use 0 or negative number to disable it as unlimited.

camel.source.endpoint.operation.name: camel.source.endpoint.operation
camel.source.endpoint.operation.description: The HBase operation to perform One of: [CamelHBasePut] [CamelHBaseGet] [CamelHBaseScan] [CamelHBaseDelete]

camel.source.endpoint.remove.name: camel.source.endpoint.remove
camel.source.endpoint.remove.description: If the option is true, Camel HBase Consumer will remove the rows which it processes.

camel.source.endpoint.removeHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.removeHandler
camel.source.endpoint.removeHandler.description: To use a custom HBaseRemoveHandler that is executed when a row is to be removed.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.hbase.poolMaxSize.name: camel.component.hbase.poolMaxSize
camel.component.hbase.poolMaxSize.description: Maximum number of references to keep for each table in the HTable pool. The default value is 10.

camel.component.hbase.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.hbase.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.hbase.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.hbase.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.hbase.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.hbase.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
